title: Polish Hanukkah candles relit after far-right fire extinguisher incident
description: The relighting ceremony was held two days after far-right lawmaker Grzegorz Braun caused outrage by blasting the Menorah display at the Polish parliament with a fire extinguisher.

title: Martin Fletcher speaks about if there can be peace in Israel and Gaza
description: Former NBC News Tel Aviv Bureau Chief Martin Fletcher explains why there could be an opportunity for peace in the region once the Israel-Hamas war ends. Fletcher states that two to three years down the road, once the dust has settled and trade resumes between Israel and Gaza, both sides will have to find a way forward.

title: Russia's Putin defiant and buoyant during marathon call-in and news conference
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin held his annual news conference and call-in show for the first time since he launched his invasion of Ukraine.

title: Putin asked what advice would he give to his younger self
description: The final question of Russian President Vladimir Putin's end-of-year marathon news conference was what advice would he had given to his younger self? Putin answered that he would tell himself, "you're going the right path."

title: WATCH: Putin quizzed about AI and body doubles by his apparent deepfake
description: During his annual news conference, Russian President Vladimir Putin was asked by a student from St. Petersburg about his concerns over artificial intelligence and if he had any body doubles. The questioner appeared to have an AI deepfake version of the president ask the question.

title: WATCH: Putin quizzed about AI and body doubles by his apparent double
description: During his annual news conference, Russian President Vladimir Putin was asked by a student from St. Petersburg about his concerns over artificial intelligence and if he had any body doubles. The questioner appeared to have an AI version of the president ask the question.

title: Israel's Netanyahu says 'nothing will stop us' despite calls for truce
description: The Israeli government says it will not stop its war with Hamas in Gaza despite growing condemnations about its costs to Palestinian civilians. After President Biden’s rebuke of what he called Israel’s ”indiscriminate bombing” in Gaza, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told Israeli troops‚ ”In the face of international pressure, nothing will stop us.” NBC’s Richard Engel reports for TODAY.

title: Israeli ambassador says there will absolutely not be a two-state solution after the war
description: Israeli ambassador says there will 'absolutely' not be a two-state solution after the war

title: Putin defends government's supply record to the Ukrainian front line
description: Responding to a question posed by a Moscow citizen in his annual news conference, Russian President Vladimir Putin defended his government's record in supplying the 617,000 troops serving on the Russian front line in Ukraine.

title: Bombardment of Khan Younis is so intense not all wounded can be rescued, medics say
description: The emergency room at Nasser Hospital in southern Gaza's Khan Younis was overwhelmed by wounded Palestinians as Israel maintained its relentless assault.

title: Putin says there is no comparison between Gaza and Ukraine conflicts
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin, speaking at an end-of-year news conference where ordinary citizens had the chance to pose questions, said there was no comparison to be drawn between the conflicts taking place in Gaza and Ukraine.

title: Vladimir Putin holds annual news conference and call-in show
description: Vladimir Putin holds annual news conference and call-in show

title: Presidents of Guyana and Venezuela to meet over territorial dispute
description: Guyana President Mohamed Irfaan Ali and Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro are scheduled to meet over a century-long territorial dispute. The meeting will be about Venezuela's interest in Essequibo, an oil-rich territory that belongs to Guyana.

title: ‘Maduro is an outlaw’ Guyana President Irfaan Ali speaks out against Venezuela
description: Guyana President Mohamed Irfaan Ali spoke out against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro during an interview with NBC News’ Tom Llamas, saying that Maduro is an "outlaw" and that his country will not give an inch of of land to Venezuela.
